artefact.overview: You need an itinerant (travelling) metal dealer's licence to buy and sell scrap metal door-to-door in Scotland
artefact.licence_short_description: An itinerant metal dealer's licence is for buying and selling scrap metal door-to-door.
artefact.licence_overview:
$!Contact your council to get an itinerant (travelling) metal dealer's licence to buy and sell scrap metal door-to-door in Scotland. $!

##Conditions

Door-to-door means that you don't store the metal on your premises. If you buy or sell scrap metal from a business premises, you should apply for a metal dealer's licence.

##Requirements

You must keep records of all transactions for 6 months. 

For metal you buy, you must record: 

- the description and weight of the scrap metal
- the name and address of the seller 
- the price of the metal

For metal you sell, keep receipts that show:

- the description and weight of the scrap metal
- the name and address of the buyer 
- the amount you sold the metal for

^If you deal in second-hand goods as well as scrap metal, you'll also need a second-hand dealer's licence.^

##How to apply

Contact your local council to apply.  

Licences are valid for 3 years. 

##Fines and penalties

If you deal in scrap metal without a licence, you can be fined up to £2,500. 

If you don't follow the licence conditions (eg if you don't keep records), you can be fined up to £1,000.
